translations.translation: with a rope of twisted fibre round her neck.
Will have a strap of fibre rope around her neck.
upon her neck shall be a rope of palm-fibre.
and so too will his wife who (threw thorns and firewood in the Prophet's way). Around her neck will be a rope of palm fibre.
A rope made from palm fibre around her neck!
In her neck is a twisted rope of Masad.
Upon her neck a halter of strongly twisted rope.
upon her neck a rope of palm-fibre.
Will have upon her neck a halter of palm-fibre.
with a rope of twisted fibre round her neck.
On her neck shall be a cord of twisted fibre.
with a rope of palm fibre around her neck.
A twisted rope of palm-leaf fibre round her (own) neck!
In her neck is a twisted rope of Masad (palm fibre).
shall have a rope of palmfiber around her neck!
Around her neck is a rope of thorns.
Around her neck is a rope of [twisted] fiber.

[111:5] with a rope of palm-fibre around her neck (fī jīdihā hablun min masadin is a circumstantial qualifier referring to hammālata’l-hatab, which in turn is [either] a description of imra’atahu, ‘his wife’, or the predicate of an implied subject). Meccan or Medinese, consisting of 4 or 5 verses. The Prophet (s) was asked about his Lord and the following was revealed:

(Will have upon her neck a halter of palm fibre) and this halter strangulated her and she died as a result; it is also said that this means: she will have an iron chain on her neck'. And of the surah in which Unity is mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 4 verses, 15 words and 47 777 letters: Surah 112: The Sincerity (al-lkhlas) And of the surah in which Unity is mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 4 verses, 15 words and 47 letters:

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text:
وقوله تعالى: { فِي جِيدِهَا } معناه في عُنقِها
 { حَبْلٌ مِّن مَّسَدٍ } معناه من لِيفٍ
 والمَسدُ: حَبلُ اللّيفِ
 ويقال: من حَديدٍ ويقال: قِلادةٌ من وَدعٍ
 ويقال: المسَدُ: حَديدُ البَكرةِ

translations.translation:
And His saying, "In goodness," meaning in her neck.


A rope made of palm fiber


And the musd: the cord of the luf.
 It is said: "A sword from a gift" and it is said: "A necklace from a gift"
 It is said: The Masdu: {Iron of the virgin}
